definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: His check bounced, leaving Jim behind the eight ball with his landlord.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆这会儿对房东糗了，因为他付给房东支票跳票了。

sentences.english: This time it's for real because the contract has been signed.
sentences.chinese: 这次应该不会跳票了，毕竟合约已经签了。

definition: to stir-fry leftover rice/fig. to rehash the same story/to serve up the same old product
to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
to put goods on shelves/(of a product) to be available for sale
to hit the market (of a new product)/to float (a company on the stock market)
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend
within the year/in the middle of the year/mid-year
